column1: Sabang is a city consisting of a main island (Weh Island) and several smaller islands off the northern tip of Sumatra. The islands form a city within Aceh Special Region
column2: Indonesia.  The administrative centre is located on Weh Island
column3: 17 km north of Banda Aceh. The city covers an area of 153.0 square kilometres and according to the 2010 census had a population of 30
column4: 653 people; the latest estimate (for July 2019) is 34
column5: 333. Sabang is also known as the northernmost and westernmost city of Indonesia.

column1: Sabang is served by the [[Maimun S
aleh Airport]]. The airport is located southeast of the central city on Weh Island.
Sabang has an ancient port on the historic Maritime Silk Route. To enhance cooperation in the national and maritime security and safety
column4: the strategic partners India and Indonesia are jointly developing the Sabang deepsea port which also lies close to the India's southernmost territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands. In 2002
column5: Indian Navy and Indonesian Navy signed "Ind-Indo Corpat" agreement. In May 2018
column6: "Shared Vision of Maritime Cooperation in the Indo Pacific" agreement was signed between these two nations when Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Indonesia. Consequently
column7: both navies have been hosting bilateral "Samudra Shakti" naval exercise since November 2018 including in Java Sea and Andaman Sea. Indian naval ships have been regularly visiting Sabang port after the signing of the agreement. Several Indian navy ships undertook naval exercises and visits to Sabang e.g. a destroyer INS Rana in 2002
column9: INS VIJIT in 2019.Indonesia's minister for maritime affairs
column11: stated that Indonesia has given economic and military access to India to strategic Sabang port which will invest in the port and economic zone of Sabang and build a hospital. He further stated that both India and Indonesia are large nations which do not need to lean towards any superpower
column12: and that Indian navy ships will have access to the port which has 40 meter depth which is good for all vessels including submarines. Both nations started to discuss the Sabang port project in 2014. Shipping lanes passing through here are the global Choke point
column13: Indonesia has “global maritime fulcrum” to counter balance the China's BRI
column14: and this new India-Indonesia strategic partnership will balance the power in IOR and address the shared India-Indonesia's concerns about China's assertiveness in this region. Port is a key element of India's Indo-Pacific strategy.

column1: The City hosted an international sail tourism event in September 2011. The sail race was participated in by around 50 ships with 15 crew members each. Besides sailing they visited interesting places packed in a 'tsunami' tourism
column2: visit Gapang Beach and Iboih Beach with enchanting underwater scenery.Sail Sabang 2017 was held from Nov. 28 until Dec. 5 in Sabang. The event is the ninth installment of Sail Indonesia
